data.title: Thais elated over international recognition for ‘Tom Yum Kung’
data.description: But see no big impact on their businesses or food choices

data.title: Thai business sector protests against 400-baht minimum wage plan
data.description: Three key business agencies will file a formal protest against the nationwide wage plan, saying it could hinder economic recovery

data.title: Thailand to host Women’s Volleyball World Championship next year
data.description: Thailand’s Cabinet on Tuesday approved a proposal to host the 2025 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship in a bid to stimulate tourism and the economy.

data.title: Thailand at risk due to govt’s financial mismanagement: TDRI chief
data.description: Somkiat said that the country’s credit rating could be downgraded if the government does not improve its macroeconomic management

data.title: Thai healthcare and wellness industry expected to grow by 9% annually
data.description: The healthcare industry is expected to grow by close to 9 per cent annually amid beauty trends and the transition towards an ageing society, several experts said on Wednesday.

data.title: Port Authority working towards green and smart future logistics hubs
data.description: Chief outlines plan to tap technology and implement innovative solutions

data.title: Paetongtarn eyes tie-up with Nvidia to turn Thailand into AI hub
data.description: The PM meets Nvidia CEO to discuss collaboration in developing Thai AI industry, building world-class infrastructure, sharing expertise and fostering talent

data.title: South Korea's opposition moves to impeach President Yoon over martial law
data.description: “President Yoon Suk Yeol’s martial law declaration was a clear violation of the constitution. It didn’t abide by any requirements to declare it,” the Democratic Party said in a statement.

data.title: Diesel, food price hikes push Thailand’s headline inflation by 0.95%
data.description: The Commerce Ministry expects inflation to continue rising in December, partly due to economic growth, higher fuel prices and increased spending after government handouts

data.title: River City Bangkok celebrates four decades shaping the Thai art scene
data.description: The “River City Bangkok: 40 Years of Magnificent Display of Art and Antiques” allows visitors to discover timeless treasures, artistic marvels and the rich tapestry of the iconic centre for art and culture that has played a pivotal role in shaping the Thai art scene for four decades.

data.title: Thai govt mulls VAT increase as part of tax reform plans
data.description: Finance minister reckons increasing VAT from current 7% rate will boost revenue and address the income inequality problem

data.title: UNESCO: Kebaya, an intangible cultural heritage
data.description: A garment noted for its complex design and elegance, the kebaya is due to earn  intangible cultural heritage status from UNESCO

data.title: Is Boonsong’s release from prison a precursor to Yingluck’s return?
data.description: Freeing of key figures sentenced in rice scandal points to implementation of Thaksin’s timeline

data.title: Same-sex marriages can be registered nationwide from Jan 22
data.description: Deputy interior minister says district offices nationwide are ready to register same-sex couples from the minute the law is promulgated

data.title: Boonsong reports to Chiang Mai probation office after parole release
data.description: Ex-minister’s son says his father will be required to inform probation officers well in advance if he goes to Bangkok for treatment

data.title: Nation Foundation, CIB provide school uniforms to students on Koh Libong
data.description: Sports equipment also delivered to school in Trang district

data.title: Suvarnabhumi’s SAT-1 wins UNESCO special prize for its exterior
data.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport’s Satellite Terminal 1 (SAT-1) has been awarded a UNESCO special prize this year for its exterior by Prix Versailles, which honours exceptional accomplishments in global architecture and design, according to the Airports of Thailand (AOT) on Wednesday.

data.title: Giant monkeys join sunflowers at Lopburi’s new landmark
data.description: Wanon Ranch has combined the province’s two iconic natural wonders to create a unique and selfie-friendly destination in central Thailand

data.title: Bangkok’s air quality deteriorates to health-risk levels
data.description: With PM2.5 pollution levels reaching the orange zone, BMA has advised residents to wear PM2.5-proof masks and limit outdoor activities

data.title: Giant monkeys join sunflowers at Lopburi’s new landmark
data.description: Wanon Ranch has combined the province’s two iconic natural wonders to create a unique and selfie-friendly destination in central Thailand

data.title: Bank of Thailand calls for urgent increase in climate finance
data.description: Huge shortfall in global funding for transition to sustainability is a major challenge for developing nations like Thailand: Deputy governor

data.title: Food for thought: Tom yum kung gets the nod from UNESCO
data.description: UNESCO celebrates Thailand’s rich cultural heritage and encourages the world to appreciate the cultural stories behind traditional foods.

data.title: Muay Thai Phenoms Johan Ghazali, Johan Estupinan booked for ONE 170 in Bangkok
data.description: Rising Muay Thai stars Johan Ghazali and Johan Estupinan are set to clash in an explosive flyweight bout at ONE 170 on January 24 at Impact Arena in Bangkok, Thailand.

data.title: Relaxation, family trips, and new destinations to shape travel next year
data.description: Digital travel platform Agoda has unveiled its 2025 Travel Trends survey, highlighting the key factors set to shape the travel landscape in Asia in the coming year.

data.title: Tom yum kung gains UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Status
data.description: Thailand celebrates another culinary tradition as its famed tom yum kung is recognised by UNESCO as an intangible cultural heritage

data.title: Thailand to harness Airbus’ expertise in becoming aviation hub
data.description: Transport Ministry to work with Europe’s Airbus to expand aviation infrastructure and raise safety standards

data.title: Embassy urges Thais in South Korea to avoid protest areas
data.description: South Korean president imposes martial law to quell political protests only to rescind the order six hours later

data.title: Attraction of the ASEAN Economic Sphere: Japanese companies transferring production from China to Southeast Asia
data.description: An increasing number of Japanese companies operating in China are transferring their production bases to countries in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). This comes as Chinese economic growth slows and concerns rise over the risks of doing business in China, where foreign residents have been arrested on vague grounds.

data.title: Attraction of the ASEAN Economic Sphere: Japanese companies transferring production from China to Southeast Asia
data.description: An increasing number of Japanese companies operating in China are transferring their production bases to countries in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). This comes as Chinese economic growth slows and concerns rise over the risks of doing business in China, where foreign residents have been arrested on vague grounds.

data.title: Central Department Store reinvents flagship Bangkok location
data.description: Central completes comprehensive 4-billion-baht renovation of its Chidlom branch

data.title: South Korea lifts martial law after lawmakers reject president’s decree
data.description: The president of South Korea early Wednesday lifted the martial law he imposed on the country hours earlier, bending to political pressure after a tense night in which troops surrounded parliament and lawmakers voted to reject military rule.

data.title: German Christmas market comes to Bangkok
data.description: Gearing up for the festive season, Goethe-Institut Thailand is organising the German Christmas Market 2024 on Sathon 1 this Saturday and Sunday, bringing joy to downtown Bangkok.

data.title: Illustration fair returns to CentralWorld
data.description: The Bangkok Illustration Fair is back with works by Thai and foreign illustrators at CentralWorld Live, 8th floor of CentralWorld, Ratchadamri Road, from tomorrow to Sunday.
